00019 /** \file
00020  \brief OBD Simulator Main Entrypoint
00021 */
00022 #ifndef __OBDSIM_H
00023 #define __OBDSIM_H
00024 
00025 #include <getopt.h>
00026 #include <stdlib.h>
00027 
00028 #include "obdservicecommands.h"
00029 
00030 /// This is the elm prompt
00031 #define ELM_PROMPT ">"
00032 
00033 /// Default hide headers
00034 #define ELM_HEADERS 0
00035 
00036 /// Default show spaces
00037 #define ELM_SPACES 1
00038 
00039 /// Default echo
00040 #define ELM_ECHO 1
00041 
00042 /// Default linefeed
00043 #define ELM_LINEFEED 1
00044 
00045 /// Default timeout, milliseconds
00046 #define ELM_TIMEOUT 200
00047 
00048 /// Adaptive timing [0,1,2]
00049 #define ELM_ADAPTIVETIMING 1
00050 
00051 /// DLC Dispaly
00052 #define ELM_DISPLAYDLC 0
00053 
00054 /// ELM "don't know" prompt
00055 #define ELM_QUERY_PROMPT "?"
00056 
00057 /// ELM "OK" prompt
00058 #define ELM_OK_PROMPT "OK"
00059 
00060 /// ELM "NO DATA" prompt
00061 #define ELM_NODATA_PROMPT "NO DATA"
00062 
00063 /// Default sim generator
00064 #define DEFAULT_SIMGEN "Cycle"
00065 
00066 /// Default windows port
00067 #define DEFAULT_WINPORT "CNCA0"
00068 
00069 /// Length of time to sleep between nonblocking reads [us]
00070 #define OBDSIM_SLEEPTIME 1000
00071 
00072 /// Print out benchmarks every this often [seconds]
00073 #define OBDSIM_BENCHMARKTIME 10
00074 
00075 /// Default car battery voltage
00076 #define OBDSIM_BATTERYV 11.8
00077 
00078 /// Hardcode maximum number of ECUs/generators
00079 #define OBDSIM_MAXECUS 6
00080 
00081 /// Max number of frames for freeze frame
00082 #define OBDSIM_MAXFREEZEFRAMES 5
00083 
00084 
00085 
00086 /// This is a frozen frame
00087 struct freezeframe {
00088     unsigned int values[sizeof(obdcmds_mode1)/sizeof(obdcmds_mode1[0])][4]; //< Up to four values for each pid
00089     unsigned int valuecount[sizeof(obdcmds_mode1)/sizeof(obdcmds_mode1[0])]; //< Number of values stored for each pid
00090 };
00091 
00092 
00093 /// An array of these is created, each for a different ECU
00094 struct obdgen_ecu {
00095     struct obdsim_generator *simgen; //< The actual data generator
00096     unsigned int ecu_num; //< The ECU that this will respond as
00097     char *seed; //< The seed used to create this simgen
00098     int lasterrorcount; //< Number of errors last time the number of frozen frames changed
00099     int ffcount; //< Current number of frozen frames
00100     struct freezeframe ff[OBDSIM_MAXFREEZEFRAMES]; //< Frozen frames
00101     void *dg; //< The generator created by this ecu
00102     int customdelay; //< This ECU takes this long to respond, ms
00103 };
00104 
00105 /// This is used for customdelays
00106 /** It implements the order that ecus
00107 respond in, and the delay before each one responds */
00108 struct obdgen_ecudelays {
00109     struct obdgen_ecu *ecu; //< A pointer to the ecu
00110     long delay; //< How long to wait [after the last ecu in this list responded]
00111 };
00112 
00113 /// All of the settings relating to the sim go into this
00114 struct simsettings {
00115     int e_headers; // Whether to show headers
00116     int e_spaces; // Whether to show spaces
00117     int e_echo; // Whether to echo commands
00118     int e_linefeed; // Whether to print \n as well as \r
00119     int e_timeout; // The timeout on requests
00120     int e_adaptive; // "Adaptive timing" [improves responsiveness]
00121     int e_dlc; // Display DLC
00122 
00123     int e_autoprotocol; // Whether or not we put the "A" and "Auto, " prefix on DP/DPN
00124     struct obdiiprotocol *e_protocol; // Starting protocol
00125 
00126     int benchmark; // Benchmark frequency
00127     float e_currentvoltage; // The current battery voltage
00128 
00129     char *device_identifier;
00130     char *elm_device;
00131     char *elm_version;
00132 
00133     struct obdgen_ecu ecus[OBDSIM_MAXECUS]; // All the ECUs
00134     int ecu_count;
00135 
00136     struct obdgen_ecudelays ecudelays[OBDSIM_MAXECUS]; // ECUs are queried in this order
00137 };
00138 
00139 
00140 // Fix "variable obdcmds defined but not used" warnings
00141 #ifdef __GNUC__
00142 #define VARIABLE_IS_NOT_USED __attribute__ ((unused))
00143 #else
00144 #define VARIABLE_IS_NOT_USED
00145 #endif
00146 
00147 /// There are 11 or so protocols, but fewer types of header layout
00148 enum protocol_headertype {
00149     OBDHEADER_NULL, // Not recognised headers
00150     OBDHEADER_J1850PWM,
00151     OBDHEADER_J1850VPW,
00152     OBDHEADER_14230,
00153     OBDHEADER_CAN29,
00154     OBDHEADER_CAN11
00155 };
00156 
00157 /// To a reset on the elm device [ATZ/D/WS]
00158 void obdsim_elmreset(struct simsettings *s);
00159 
00160 /// Each OBDII Protocol has a number and description
00161 struct obdiiprotocol {
00162     char protocol_num;
00163     const char *protocol_desc;
00164     enum protocol_headertype headertype;
00165 };
00166 
00167 /// All the protocols I know or care about 
00168 /** Borrowed from the ELM327 datasheet */
00169 static struct obdiiprotocol VARIABLE_IS_NOT_USED obdprotocols[] = {
00170     { '0', "Automatic", OBDHEADER_NULL },
00171     { '1', "SAE J1850 PWM", OBDHEADER_J1850PWM }, // 41.6 Kbaud
00172     { '2', "SAE J1850 VPW", OBDHEADER_J1850VPW }, // 10.4 Kbaud
00173     { '3', "ISO 9141-2", OBDHEADER_J1850VPW }, // 5 baud init, 10.4 Kbaud
00174     { '4', "ISO 14230-4 (KWP 5BAUD)", OBDHEADER_14230 }, // 5 baud init, 10.4 Kbaud
00175     { '5', "ISO 14230-4 (KWP FAST)", OBDHEADER_14230 }, // fast init, 10.4 Kbaud
00176     { '6', "ISO 15765-4 (CAN 11/500)", OBDHEADER_CAN11 }, // 11 bit ID, 500 Kbaud
00177     { '7', "ISO 15765-4 (CAN 29/500)", OBDHEADER_CAN29 }, // 29 bit ID, 500 Kbaud
00178     { '8', "ISO 15765-4 (CAN 11/250)", OBDHEADER_CAN11 }, // 11 bit ID, 250 Kbaud
00179     { '9', "ISO 15765-4 (CAN 29/250)", OBDHEADER_CAN29 }, // 29 bit ID, 250 Kbaud
00180     { 'A', "SAE J1939 (CAN 29/250)", OBDHEADER_CAN29 }, // 29 bit ID, 250* Kbaud
00181     { 'B', "USER1 CAN", OBDHEADER_CAN11 }, // 11* bit ID, 125* Kbaud
00182     { 'C', "USER2 CAN", OBDHEADER_CAN11 }, // 11* bit ID, 50* Kbaud
00183 };
00184 
00185 /// Default protocol. Looked up early on - better match something from the above list
00186 #define OBDSIM_DEFAULT_PROTOCOLNUM "8"
00187 
00188 /// Print all protocol info to stdout
00189 void printobdprotocols();
00190 
00191 /// Given a protocol [A]{0-9}, set the protocol in the struct
00192 /** \return 0 for success, <0 for failure
00193  */
00194 int set_obdprotocol(const char *prot, struct simsettings *ss);
00195 
00196 /// Given the single char, find the protocol for it
00197 struct obdiiprotocol *find_obdprotocol(const char *protocol_num);
00198

00200 /// getopt() long options
00201 static const struct option longopts[] = {
00202     { "help", no_argument, NULL, 'h' }, ///< Print the help text
00203     { "genhelp", required_argument, NULL, 'e' }, ///< Print the help for a generator
00204     { "list-generators", no_argument, NULL, 'l' }, ///< Print a list of generators
00205     { "version", no_argument, NULL, 'v' }, ///< Print the version text
00206     { "seed", required_argument, NULL, 's' }, ///< Seed
00207     { "benchmark", required_argument, NULL, 'n' }, ///< Benchmark seconds
00208     { "generator", required_argument, NULL, 'g' }, ///< Choose a generator
00209     { "customdelay", required_argument, NULL, 'd' }, ///< Custom delay for this ecu
00210     { "logfile", required_argument, NULL, 'q' }, ///< Write to this logfile
00211     { "elm-version", required_argument, NULL, 'V' }, ///< Pretend to be this on ATZ
00212     { "elm-device", required_argument, NULL, 'D' }, ///< Pretend to be this on AT@1
00213     { "protocol", required_argument, NULL, 'p' }, ///< Set the default protocol to this
00214     { "list-protocols", no_argument, NULL, 'L' }, ///< List known protocols
00215 #ifdef OBDPLATFORM_POSIX
00216     { "launch-logger", no_argument, NULL, 'o' }, ///< Launch obdgpslogger
00217     { "launch-screen", no_argument, NULL, 'c' }, ///< Launch screen
00218     { "tty-device", required_argument, NULL, 't' }, ///< Open this actual device instead of a pty
00219 #endif //OBDPLATFORM_POSIX
00220 #ifdef OBDPLATFORM_WINDOWS
00221     { "com-port", required_argument, NULL, 'w' }, ///< Windows com port to open
00222 #endif //OBDPLATFORM_WINDOWS
00223 #ifdef HAVE_BLUETOOTH
00224     { "bluetooth", no_argument, NULL, 'b' }, ///< Listen with bluetooth
00225 #endif //HAVE_BLUETOOTH
00226 #ifdef HAVE_SOCKET
00227     { "socket", required_argument, NULL, 'k' }, ///< Listen with socket
00228 #endif //HAVE_SOCKET
00229     { NULL, 0, NULL, 0 } ///< End
00230 };

00234 #ifdef OBDPLATFORM_POSIX

00245 #endif //HAVE_SOCKET

00252 void printhelp(const char *argv0);
